author: adatomsnft
title: ADATOMS HQ Science & DeFi Dec. Ed.
description: Most of the community is lacking the basic scientific, logic and Financial abilities to have a healthy participation in the Cardano network

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of this proposal is to create educational podcast stored on the blockchain. While it is a commendable action, this idea simply does not fit into the challenge. By creating educational podcast would not help facilitate projects and dapps to migrate from ethereum to the Cardano network. This challenge is about creating a path for dapps from the account-style method to the UTXO method. I dont see any of your plans that might benefit or contribute to this campaign. I suggest that you try to submit your proposal in other challenge such as miscellaneous challenge that might fit with your proposals problem statement and solution should you try to reattempt to submit your proposal on the next funding. Therefore this proposal is not align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a PhD student that has done some research in the past few years who also loves to educate people thru his podcast. With such passion, he might have the ability to successfully implement the the project. He also identifies the required manhours and resources needed to execute the plan where he requested the budget breakdown for his equipments. Most of the requested funds are for his tools to create content and also his living expenses which doesnt give much impact to the community as a whole especially in our pursuit of creating an easy transition for account-style method to UTXO. Furthermore, the budget allocation to service his cost of living is not sustainable. Try to develop a business model for your proposal in order for you to keep generating income from doing what you love. Moreover, the plan provided by the proposer also has no relation to creating or improving the process of the great migration. Should the proposer reattempt to submit another proposal in the next funding round, it is advised to choose a challenge that fits better with this project. In conclusion, I disagree that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I find that this proposal lacks roadmap with milestones for achievement. Include a clear timeframe of your plan implementation for the community to audit your progress on your next proposal. Furthermore, the success metrics are not clearly defined. Creating content alone is not enough without the audience. On your next proposal, include how many people that you aim to reach and also within what timeframe. In addition, the proposer did not mention where the community can keep track of the progress. The proposer did provided with his website link so it is presumable that all of the progress will be recorded there. With the above assessment,I find that the information provided is not sufficient to be audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
"In this solution description, the proposer has defined clearly their current project's contents and strongly highlighted the positive impact and wish to make greater contribution to develop Cardano ecosystem. The writing style of the proposer is pretty easily understandable. However, in this part, this solution could be illustrated in a better and clearer way if the proposer can give more detailed explanations about how the project works technically and other functions and features of ADATOMS. 
The demonstrations on how this solution addresses the challenge is explicitly clear as the proposer answers each and every question of the OSDE challenge. They somewhat proved that the project's values serve the community development, it is sustainable with top quality education, and also there are ways to collaborate with others. Yet, personally I think if the proposer can point out clearer and more detailed on how and how many developers, projects, artists, etc. would join in this project, then the persuasiveness is way stronger. As I have mentioned that the proposer answers questions belonging to OSDE challenge while somehow this proposal is classified as The Great Migration from Ethereum challenge. In this case, the proposal seems to having worked with EVM-based developers and projects and now wanting to build integration with Cardano. In order to fit more with the assigned challenge, the proposer could present the benefits of this new migration towards Cardano ecosystem. 
In the foreseen risks, the proposer have stated clearly their current troubles and problems; however, it would gain more impact gradings if they could tell more on how the fund and aid from Cardano can help them solve out the problems and how it helps contribute and make the current situation of the project better. "
f6_assessments.q1:
"In the detailed timeline and plan provision part, the proposal has provided a great list of the products that they have done before, which is a good evidence for the feasibility of the future of the project. However, the list of already made products would be more suitable if put in the solution description or the auditability part in my opinion. In this part, so as to make it better, they should provide their plan to develop, widen and broaden the existing project; the planned methods and ways to collaborate with experts and other projects. They do mention the plan to have institutional collaborations in the future and it should be elaborated in a more detailed way such as which institution or university they would collaborate, by when in this year they would successfully gain that. A more explicit plan with specific tasks and time limit accordingly would create a more feasible proposal.
Other than that, the proposer has shown a very strong passion for the project and yearn for contributing to the community, enhancing the education of science and finance for the community. 
The budget breakdown is clear in term of its usage purpose. The proposer also expresses his longing for the fund and how it affects not only himself but the migration of Ethereum - Cardano and the impact on community from his project scale. Yet, the budget should be broken down intro smaller numbers for each spendings. For example, the 16000USD paid for his whole year expenses needs to be more specific and clarified in smaller unit of time such as PhD costs 7200$ per year (3600$ per semester).
The profile of this proposer is well-written with his list of experiences, degrees, research as well as connections and achievements in Cardano ecosystem, which all related to the implemetation of this project. 
In general, the writing style of this proposal should be more formal and professional rather than a friendly spoken style in order to make it more persuasive, according to my point of view."
f6_assessments.q2:
"The key metrics of this proposal is visible and easy to be measured as they are the number of lectures that the proposer can produce. The clarity of this proposal could be hightened if the proposer can add the time limit for those measurable results. For instance, 'Finishing the DeFi-ning Education! series (currently at chapter 4, still about 7 more to go)' in 3 months.
The success of this proposal is illustrated with a great confidence from the author. It is vividly clear but as the proposer is asking fund to improve the quality of the products as well (funding for better devices), the proposer could describe some more on the quality improvement of the products. Additionally, the author could illustrate more about the better collaborations with other experts or educational institutions in order to upgrade the project that create a bigger impact on community, or the success in the migration from Ethereum such as the numbers of users that will be beneficial to Cardano ecosystem. 
Besides, SDG rating adds a minor plus point to this proposal."

f6_assessments.q0: The goal of F8: The Great Migration is to make it easier for developers and projects based in EVM to migrate to the Cardano Ecosystem. Specific learning material, as proposed here have the potential to attract more users to the cardano chain. However, this material needs to be focused on deploying and developing dApps and project on Cardano specifically - the proposal seems to be much more general in this aspect. Finally, when primarily focusing on Cardano development, this project may improve migration to Cardano by providing more education on the topic.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer clearly has a lot of experience in developing educational material. There also seem to be a lot of lectures available already both in English and Spanish. The plan seems to comprise fitting basic and technical requirements of the author which will then develop more content on its own. A more detailed plan on suggested topics, relevant to the funding goal would be desirable, given the broad spectrum of provided existing material.
f6_assessments.q2: The success and progress of this proposal is suggested to be measured in produced episodes of educational material. The author suggests that the project is already successfull and provides a ~1k follower twitter page corresponding to the project. Interaction with this account or some website/forum where active watchers of the material are interacting would be preferrable as a means of assessing the progress/success of the project - it is not enough to produce content, but it needs to also reach users. Finally of course, the success of educational material is always hard to measure, therefore only incomplete ways of assessment are available.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified a problem and a solution to the problem but it looks like they don't fit into the Challenge brief (it has nothing related with the migration from Ethereum BC - Miscellaneous category could be more appropriate).

It is not clear what is the real value added to the Cardano ecosystem. The provided educational materials can be found in various forms couple of clicks away (what is the reason of securing educational content in the Cardano blockchain?)
f6_assessments.q1:
There are some references provided for some written materials but there are no evidence of references to associate the proposer with a real person thus making difficult to assess his area of expertize.

The budget is broken down into identifiable items but the biggest part ($16.000) of it is requested for the proposer self support and not for the project implementation.

The proposal does not offer a realistic timetable to complete the work (a timetable with achievable milestones - what is to be done in a defined time period).

The proposal, as it is, doesn't look like a working product
f6_assessments.q2: Based on the information provided is difficult to objectively assess it as it lacks in providing relevant aspects to make the proposal a viable product. Perhaps, rephrasing it and fitting it in the right funding category will have a better chance in the future.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal identifies a valid problem and suggests an interesting solution. But unfortunately it is not well framed in the challenge.
 
The proposal does not clarify how this project is specifically valuable in achieving the migration of Ethereum users to Cardano.
 
The project dwells on its numerous virtues, but does not focus on how this educational podcast would achieve the objectives that this challenge requires.
 
I like the project and I think it can and is having an impact, but to ask for funds from the community it needs to be framed in the corresponding challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Although the proposer does not provide links about himself, he does provide numerous links about his work. Something even more important to show himself as suitable for the task.
 
The budget is peculiar. Instead of putting a price on his work, the proposer lists his bills to pay. I think this can improve in the future. However it seems (quantity-wise) reasonable.
 
There is no timetable provided. Something very important for this field.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability of this project is easy to control. Success in this project will happen if the proposer is able to continue making their educational podcasts.
 
There is a clear identification of a problem, and a good solution to it. The proposer has been working on the problem for a long time, so the auditability process would be simple: check that the proposer continues to do his job.
 
However, the roadmap is not detailed enough and the KPIs are not clearly stated. Two central formalities for this field that can be improved for the future and that force me to reduce one point in this category.

solution: ADATOMS gives 100% Free TOP QUALITY Scientific and Financial education, securing all our educational content in the Cardano blockchain.
experience: I am a top tier chemist & PhD student in Chile and well known member and contributor of the community. Many years of research and education experience. Wide experience in the NFT ecosystem, pushing innovation in the use of Cardano (metadata) for a variety of academic purposes.
